intro: Pedicularis likiangensis subsp. likiangensis, commonly known as the Yunnan lousewort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its spurred flowers, which are typically bright red or orange, and its basal leaves that are often lance-shaped. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
